etymology.description: phonetic: 余(余) (yú) + semantic: 食(食) (shí, "eat") = eating that is remaining -> surplus, remainder
etymology.interpretation: The character 餘(餘) (yú) combines 余(余) (yú), a phonetic element meaning "I," with 食(食) (shí, "eat") to convey the concept of a surplus or remainder after eating, which fittingly extends to the idea of something left over.
etymology.simplification: 余(余) retains the phonetic component without the semantic 食(食), focusing on simplicity by removing the eating element while keeping the core pronunciation.

examples.chinese: 余喜欢读书(余喜歡讀書)。
余游历名山(余遊歷名山)，探索古今(探索古今)。
examples.english: I travel through famous mountains and explore the ancient and the modern.

examples.chinese: 余静坐思过(余靜坐思過)。
examples.english: I sit quietly and reflect on my mistakes.
